properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Showers and a few slow moving thundershowers have developed over southwest Nova Scotia and are forecast to continue through the afternoon and possibly the evening. General rainfall amounts of near 5 mm are forecast however areas under the heaviest showers could experience rainfall rates of 20 mm an hour. This could result in cumulative amounts of 20 mm or more. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-14T23:49:48-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-14T14:08:48-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0277258665.2020
Area: Digby County, Lunenburg County, Queens County, Shelburne County, Yarmouth County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A band of heavy rain will continue to affect areas near the Caribou Mountains. Additional rainfall amounts of 30 to 50 mm can be expected tonight with an another 5 to 10 mm Tuesday morning. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-14T19:13:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-14T03:14:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3640050073.2020
Area: Mackenzie Co. near Bistcho Lake, Mackenzie Co. near Rainbow Lake Zama Lake and Chateh, Mackenzie Co. near Zama City, Mackenzie Co. near Indian Cabins and Steen River, Mackenzie Co. near Meander River and Lutose, Mackenzie Co. near High Level and Bushe River Res., Co. of Northern Lights near Paddle Prairie Smt, Mackenzie Co. near the Caribou Mountains, Mackenzie Co. near Fort Vermilion, Mackenzie Co. near John D'or Prairie and Fox Lake, Mackenzie Co. near La CrÃªte and Buffalo Head Prairie, Mackenzie Co. near the Tallcree and Wadlin Lake Reserves
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing heavy rain. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-14T23:59:31-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-14T15:07:31-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2928401870.2020
Area: Digby County, Lunenburg County, Queens County, Shelburne County, Yarmouth County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, continues. 40 to 60 mm of rain can be expected tonight and into Tuesday morning with the possibility of some localities seeing over 90 mm. The rain is expected to end Tuesday afternoon. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-14T19:13:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-14T03:14:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1427282874.2020
Area: Hay River Region including Enterprise
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, continues. Nearly 50 mm of rain has already fallen Monday and Monday night. Heavy rainfall will continue today with additional amounts of 10 to 20 mm. The rain is expected to end this afternoon and evening. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-15T00:00:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-14T11:03:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1447905894.2020
